metadata.feature_description: Option to hide the Windows authentication login button from the login page

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Extensions > Authentication Systems > DNNPro_ActiveDirectoryAuthentication > Site Settings
steps.expected: AD Authentication settings page loads with 'Hide Login Controls?' checkbox visible
steps.actual: Settings page loaded successfully showing 'Hide Login Controls?' checkbox (unchecked by default)

steps.expected: Settings are saved and checkbox remains checked
steps.actual: Settings saved successfully, checkbox remains checked after page refresh

steps.expected: Settings are saved and checkbox remains unchecked
steps.actual: Settings saved successfully, checkbox remains unchecked after page refresh

observations: The 'Hide Login Controls?' setting is located in the Site Settings tab of the DNNPro_ActiveDirectoryAuthentication extension configuration
The setting controls whether Windows authentication login controls are hidden from the login page
Based on code review: when this setting is enabled (HideWindowsLogin=true), the Windows authentication tab/button is hidden from the login page but automatic IP-based authentication may still work
The setting is stored as portal setting 'AD_HideWindowsLogin' and persists correctly across saves
